DOC.brief_summary: In Japan, post-approval execution of post marketing surveillance (PMS) is requested by the Japanese Pharmaceutical Affairs Law (J-PAL) in order to accumulate safety and efficacy data for reexamination. Reexamination period is defined by J-PAL. Eight years after approval of a new substance, results of PMS need to be submitted as a part of reexamination dossier to the Japanese regulatory authority, the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (MHLW).
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: Patients with EGFR mutationpositive inoperable or recurrent NSCLC will be included. Exclusion criteria: None
